name: Vrbinc Caravan Stop
description: It's a place for caravans next to a hotel. If you need wifi, go to the hotel next door, there is free wifi available. I payed 12€ for one night alone with my van! Included bathroom with hot shower and toilets! If you need electricity it cost you 5€ more! It's just 5km away from the city center of Ljubiana. So if you have a bike or a longboard it's perfect, you'll just need 10 minutes to reach the beautiful centre of Ljubiana.

name: Camp Lucija
description: This campground is placed directly on the see and harbor. I payed for one person and my van with electricity and tax like 17€ per night!(low-season) Toilets are not the best, but shower has hot water!

name: Camping Putj
description: Nice grassy / shady spot on the river near the old center of Putj. Clean facilities. Quiet. Laundry, tennis courts, pool or spa complex(?) adjacent but I didn't use.

name: Dujceva Kamp
description: This camp in part of a working farm. Big grassing field/island with river running either side and bridge access. Clean toilets and showers. Wifi at reception/farm house/restaurant. €15 for 1 adult tent camping.

name: Jelovica Forest
description: Flat grassy clearing off of power lines track surrounded by big pine trees. Field can be soft in places so big rigs take care. Access is via grave tracks from road.

name: Kamp Koren
description:
Nice campground. Lots of shade. Can get packed in the high season. Easy walk to the center of Kobadrid. For bathing you better walk a bit in the direction of the village. We had to pay 28,68€ for 2 persons, a van without electricity. 
There's another campground a little bit further in the other side of the river: Kamp Lazar. I didn't visit it, but I saw the campground from the hills during a hike. It might be a better option for bathing but it's a longer walk to the center of Kobadrid.

name: Vina Saksida
description: Small family-run campsite in a wine yard, around 15 pitches and some extra space for tents in the wine yard. 10 EUR per person incl. electricity, internet and shower. Pool. Nice view. Yes we recommend eating in the restaurant, execellent set meal 6 cours each with a diffrent own wine, 40 EUR.

name: Pivka Jama Camping
description: Large Forest Camping, ok facilities, pool, tennis court, restaurant, wifi only at designated point, washing machine. And an own Cave (visits at 9am and 5pm, we did not). The righthand side of the areal tends to be overcrowded with campingcars. On the lefthand side you can stand peaceful between trees. You always find a spot even if you arrive late. Better than expected at such a popular destination (Postojna Cave nearby). EUR 25 for 2

name: Kamp Gabrije
description: Basic campside. Beautiful located on river Soca. Even if you arrive late, the camping is never full, but so gets the field next to :-). Not enough facilities therefore, but clean. They book adventure activities and you can bath in the Soca. 26 EUR for 2. no electricity and 4x4

name: Kamp Sobec
description: Huge Campground with everything. Shop with good range, swimming lake, sports facilities. Even if you arrive late you will find a pitch. But not in walking distance of Bled. EUR 35 for 2 incl. elec. EUR 31 without

name: Kamp Liza
description: Smaller campground at river, beautiful located, fireplaces at some pitches, very popular among kayakers. Restaurant sells bread in the morning. Owner seems a bit unorganized, but we liked the place anyway. Around 28 EUR for 2 with electricity, 25 EUR without. 3 other campings just next door.

name: Camp Zlatorog Bohinj
description:
Beautiful campground at beautiful lake Bohinj, surrounded by beautiful mountains. Very popular but not massiv overcrowded as they let only a certain amount of people in - in high season don't come too late. No other possibility in Ukanc to stand for the night. EUR 25 for 2 with electricity, EUR 22 without.
In high season the place was totally overcrowded for days. It's a problem because in that wildlife park area including the village Ukanc wild camping is totally forbidden. All the parking lots in Ukanc are controlled by the police daily. Sometimes they "accept" camper in those days if they pay 5 EUR parking fine per day.

name: Old open air bar
description: A place up on a hill that seems to be a former bar location because you can still see the seats and tables. Reach it via a paved road in bad condition. It ist a little messy but quiet and you can see the ocean.

name: Sabotín, Slovenia
description: On top of the Sabotin mountains, which rise from the shores of the Soka river, with a breathtaking view over the Adriatic. Apart from enjoying the landscape we can walk a circular route, either from here or starting from the Soka bridge, going through  passages, caves, shelters and trenches built by the Italians and Astro -Hungaros armies during the First World War.

name: Loce
description: It is an area for resting, with shadow, nice view, a table a a bench. The local brought us some beer for us to enjoy the evening.

name: Grajski park vitez
description: campground in the garden of the renovated castle of Logatec. It is 20/25 km south of Ljubljana and north of Postonja. We could stay for free because the season was not started yet (it was april).

name: Camping Bled
description: Nice clean Campground. Established trees. Hot showers. Good facilities

name: Kamp danica
description: Nice campsite with all you need. Get one of the spots next to the river and enjoy !

name: Camping Lovsin
description:
Small really quiet campsite next to the river. Swimming possible next to the old mill, cafe available onsite. Kanoe rental possible.. recommended if you're looking for a quiet spot ! 
Grassy level field with lots of trees and shade.

name: Autocamp Kekec
description: Standard campsite, close to Maribor. Clean facilities.

name: Kamp Triglav
description: Nice official camping ground in the nature reserve, with clean toilet, shower, electricity, bus stop (to go to Bovec, Vršič pass, Kranjska Gora or Ljubljana). If its full (which can happen in high season) they have some extra space behind the official camping site for vans (as seen on the photo). Costs: About 20-25 EUR for a van and 2 persons per night.

name: by the bridge
description:
no facilities, parking next to bridge, mostly out of sight, 2-3 places, not very scenic, just praktical, easy access to the shallow river, road noise, 
entrace is a few meters after the bridge on the right (direction to Bistrica), do not cross the railroad, follow the tiny dirtroad down about 100m. you will find 2 places. Quiet, only in the morning workers showed up to repair the bridge.

 Big rigs might make it to the first two spots, too.

 If you drive on under the little railbridge, you will reach a much nicer spot at the river (200m). Attention when rainy, the puddle under the bridge gets quite deep.

name: Tolmin Gorge
description:
nice walk along soca river canyon. 5euro /p, 1h, easy, dogs allowed, but they should be well behaved, otherwise its stressfull. Pathes are norrow, and you will go back and forth sometimes, and chances are high you meet other dogs along the path. Parking can get crowded. 
Parking not really suitable for camping, as in full sight of the tiny restaurant. 
Some walking pathes start here.

name: Lonely Parking
description:
Parking near Metal Days Festival area in dead end street. (festivals take place only sometimes, otherwise deserted). 
Didn't stay here, but looks like nobody would disturb you. Some buildings a bit further away. 
Water from the river, ca. 5 min walk. 
beautiful riverwalk with little tiny, stoney beaches. Hardly anybody around. Bring your bathing suit. 
You could probably find a place to pitch a tent. 

It's very difficult to find any wildcamps in the area. Here there is no sign, that you can not camp.

name: Vrbje
description: Official free camperstop on a nice park close to some rivers. Possibility for waste water/toilet disposal and against payment fresh water (10 cent for 8 liter) and electricity (50 cent 1KWh).

name: Camp near castle
description: A free camper van ground near entrance of a 16th century castle. There is a camper van parking sign on an abandoned building. Quiet during night, but some car noise at the day.

name: bushcamp
description:
50 near the road
a little uphill nobody will see you
the only thing you hear are birds and sometimes a car
an open flat space surrounded by trees

name: Parking near Sheraton
description:
Park & Ride near Sheraton Hotel.
Near A11 so it's not silent.

name: Pension Patrick
description: Nice place with a very friendly owner - EUR 10/night

name: Bled RV parking
description: City lot for buses and RVs. Walking distance to the town and lake. Gas station and grocery store/cafe/pharmacy/toilets right next door. €10 for 24 hours but I think it was free on Sundays.

name: Trnek
description: Free camping @ natural reserve next to restaurant. Diner preferred also breakfast is possible. Very relaxed stay.

name: Camp Vrhpolje
description: Small camping in the town of Vrhpolje. Postojna Cave is easily accessible and also Triglav National Park. We stopped here for one night on our way from the Dolomites to Croatia. The daughter of the owner gave us ice cream because we said no to the home made wine. A real gem. And also affordable: 2 persons with 2 motorcycles and a small tent for one night 20€

name: Camp Špik
description:
A three star camping 6 Km from Kranjska Gora. It is all you can expect from a camping. It is clean and quiet and the view is magnificent. There is also a climbing wall, a store and a play ground for kids. There are a lot of bike routes and hiking routes here. 
PS 25% off for motorcyclists

name: Gostilna pri Boštjanu
description: Lovely quiet restaurant with a wonderfull view! Has traditional dishes & a homemade whine.

name: Camperstop Portoroz Habour
description: Camperstop in the Portoroz habour. Directly to the sea. Beach-showers. Nice view. Small bar and small playground for children. Expensive for a camperstop: 36€ for one night.

name: Camp Siber
description: Small campground on Tolminska river. There's a small path who follows the river to reach the center of Tolmin. Good price. We had to pay 18€ for 2 persons and a van (without electricity).

name: Field for parking nearby castle
description: Field for parking nearby castle. Castle only open on weekends and holidays. Therefore nobody comes by. We pitched up our tent, but bigger cars can stay there too. Great view into the valley. Even dixi toilets available at the parking lot.

name: Just off the main road
description: Just off the inland main road #7/E61 crossing the small part of Slovenia from Italy to Croatia. Plenty of space and all flat. Trees give good coverage towards the main road, so one cannot be seen. There is less traffic during the night, but the trucks can still be heard.

name: Big parking
description:
We ask to people who works on wood shop to stay the night. It was very quiet. First vehicles arrive around 7:00 AM.

Après avoir demandé à des employés du magasin de bois d'à côté, nous nous sommes posé pour la nuit. Très calme. le parking commence à se remplir vers 7h.

name: Kamp Perun
description: Established basic campground with showers etc. No swimming pool, but you can swim in the river (muddy). €29 for a camper and 2 persons, €4,- extra for electricity. Nice staff, good WiFi.

name: Camp Lijak
description: a beautiful camp not so expensive . wonderful landscape, very clean WC and bathroom. a lot of things To do around and To visit.

name: Lakefront
description: Nice quiet Place to Stay for a Night. Can stay directly on waterfront.

name: Dead End next to Mangert Street
description: Next to the Road up the Mangert there is an unfinished dead end road where you can park. Even ground, waterfall next by. View is great except the street. Stayed there for one night. Nobody cared.

name: Camp Podljubelj
description: Big grassy low key campsite in the Karawank Alps. Enthusiastic owners who give you a lot of information on walks and tours in the area. Beautiful surroundings. On the road to Klagenfurt (A), bypassing the Karawankentunnel. 20,30 Euro for campervan + 2 persons

name: Camping Podzemelj
description: Camping and cabins next to the river. Very nice spots down by the river with trees. Perfect and clean amenities. Bike rental. Great for kids. Pretty surroundings. Shop close by.

name: ECO River Camp
description:
Eco River Camp is a sanctuary of tranquility and natural beauty. Surrounded by the Sava River, this idyllic retreat offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. 

At the heart of the camp lies Rex's Bar, a delightful oasis where tantalizing aromas fill the air, tempting guests with delicious cuisine and refreshing drinks. As the sun sets, a campfire flickers to life, casting a warm glow that invites you to unwind with a drink in hand. Gather around the fire, exchange stories, and forge connections with fellow travelers. 

The camp features tent pitches amidst nature's embrace, where you can wake up to the sounds of birdsong, as well as campervan spots equipped with electricity for added comfort. Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of the Slovenian wilderness, breathe in the crisp air, and experience the magic of Eco River Camp.

name: Kamp Korita
description: Nice little camp ground right next to the river. 20€ for two person and camper without electricity. Wifi available if you need. Very clean facilities. Many nice and small hiking paths nearby. Due the low altitude (about 600m) not that cold (mid September). Not that crowded.

name: Tivoli Park Parking
description: Shaded parking lot next to the park a short walk into town. Safe and quiet. It's says .60/hour but we were here 24 hours and paid 3 Euros. 1 hour free wifi a day city wide

name: Dolgi Most P+R
description:
Big parking area, with sites for Caravans. 
There is a dump station, free water and electricity at site. and some picnic tables. It's 10€ per 24 hours. You can buy a Urbia Parking Card at the Ticket machine for 2 €. This card is working for travelling by bus. 8min to the old city by bus.

name: Into the woods
description: Very cozy place in the forest. Fits up to 4 vehicles. Only a few locals have taken their dogs for a walk a long the road.

name: one night stop
description: good for one night before crossing the border to Croatia. Spot is off the main road. No facilities. Please keep it clean.

name: Senkova Domacija
description: Beautifull camp site and hostel/hotel at the base of the pass into Austria. Family is restoring an old farmhouse with all buildings. Very quiet. Plenty of space to pitch your tent, kitchen (incl ammenities) available for cooking, very nice and new toilets and showers, restaurant also present. You can even sleep in the hay loft. When out of season, eating with the family is possible. Cost for 1p, tent & motorbike: €12 Limited space for motorhomes.

name: Speed Queen Ljubljana
description: Self service laundromat, 4€ for 9kg, 1€ for drying. Opened 6.00-24.00 every day. Free wifi.

name: Camper stop at restaurant
description: We stayed here in winter so the restaurant was closed but it's an official camper night stop. There aren't any services but the view is nice. Restaurant with toilets in summer.

name: Forest Mud Parking
description: Little place next to the forest with nice view. Muddy when rainy:-)

name: Kamp Polje
description:
Small, a bit remote campground near Novo Mesto. Having all you need to spend a night or a week: nice, clean showers/toilets, common area, canoo rental, etc.
~20€/night for 2 persons and a campervan incl. electricity, hot showers, tourist tax and wifi.

name: one of the best
description: fantastic spot for motorhomes only. Provided by the local community free of charge. This place has free water, electricity, rubbish bins a dump point and toilets in the sports club next to it. Great restaurants are in walking distance. This place is very clean please keep it this way.

name: Hostel Pekarna
description:
nice hostel in maribor .. near from center .
have parking outside of the hostel but safe . 
25€ shared rooms 
with breakfast

name: Vintgar River and Cave walk
description: Super cool attraction with one of Slovenia’s beautiful lakes running through a valley. Amazing place to get some epic pictures while in and around Bled.

name: Camping-Celje
description: About 7 kilometres from Celje, a relaxed campground behind a local bar. €18 for 2 people with a tent and a motorcycle. Very friendly and tranquil.

name: Pizzeria Plus Sevnica
description: Delicious pizza and vegetarian plate. Try it!

name: Free Camp Sevnica
description: Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity, dump station and wifi (near castle). No toilets. Thank you Sevnica!

name: Waterfall Bojana
description: Start of the 20min hiking trail to the waterfall bojana. You can go further up after you reach the waterfall. There you will find a flat and grassy area.

name: Field in Forest
description: Big open area in the forest. Very quiet, far from everything. We came with 2 motorbikes and camped in the middle of the field.

name: Istrabenz Plini
description:
Filled my Gaslow tanks. Can fill any bottle. 
Mon Fri 8 to 4.  price 12€ for 5 kg.
Has small disposable tanks also several kinds of small refillable tanks for sale. Very efficient. Facilities very modern. 
Tel: 05 663 46 00
www.istrabenzplini.sl
info@istrabenzplini.sl

name: Pri Ancki
description: A small out-of-the-way Guest house about 8 miles (13) outside Ljubjlana. The owner speaks English and motorcyclists are welcome. Parking on site but not covered/secure.

name: Camping Mirjam
description:
Established campsite in a great setting. It's in the village of Razdrto, overlooked by the most spectacular mountain - Nanos. 

Apart from a little (non-food) bar, there is a no facilities in the village. The campsite also has a bar but again, no food. There's a regular bus to the nearby town of Postojna, only 15 minutes away, where you can find supermarkets and shops, etc.

Very quiet and laidback place to pitch your tent or park up your RV. I cycled past on the 409 road and detoured in to the village to take a better look at the spectacular mountain overlooking it, and ended up staying four nights. 

Three hour hike to the top of the mountain begins by the church. Lovely campsite.

name: Picikato
description: Amazing amount of food, known for the pizza but the menu (English menu on request and everyone speaks it) is extensive. Huge salads, great pizza and almost everything you order is great. Can park some bigger rigs in lower lot. They deliver too!

name: Camping Belvedere
description: High above the sea, 3 sites without any toilet/ ablution block ..16Euros/pers...one hour parking fee 3 euros money talks here

name: Free Camp Tribej
description: Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity and dump station. No toilets. Next to the river. There is low wifi signal next to the farm house, maybe it is private but open:-). It was free of charge.

name: Camper parking Trzic
description:
Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity, dump station and wifi (1h/day). No toilets. 
Price 7€ for campervan per 24h
Thank you Trzic!

name: Autokamp Smica
description: Nice campground next to the river. Friendly owner and everything was clean! 8Euro/person and night. Dog was free! Wifi at the entrance Recommended!

name: River Trail
description: Nice walk along the beautiful river. There are several spots for a refreshing bath.

name: Babji Zob Night of Silence
description: We had two perfect nights here. Hiking trail to Babji Zob starts at this point. There is also a climbing spot next to this parking.

name: Kamp Klin
description: Nice campground direct at the river. Small walk to the gorge where you can jump from rocks into the river. Fuuuuun! Wifi only at the restaurant. Highly recommended!

name: Camping Radenci ob Kolpi
description:
Nice campground on a grassy field.
Located directly at the river.
Bathrooms not the newest, but clean.
11,90 € per person. 
You can rent canoes and make tours.
We really like it.

name: Lake Soboško jezero
description: Wild camping spot near the lake and Expano on the outskirts of Murska Sobota city. There is a restaurant close to the lake. Highway is close, so it can be a bit noisy during the night.

name: Ledava Lake
description: Nice fishing area behind the football pitch next to the lake. Really quiet a night. Fire pit, flat area, tap water, but not sure it's possible to swim into the lake. Some mosquitos.

name: Camping Stellplatz
description: Big parking lot, no tents allowed. but OK for rigs and cars, some facilities

name: Camp Natura (Aqualuna Water Park)
description: Neat and tidy campsite next to the water park, Eu71 for a night’s camping and access to the water park for 2 adults and 2 kids. An absolute score and great site if you have kids with you. There is also an abandoned castle on the hill nearby which is great to explore.

name: Camping Smlednik
description: Little camping place | River close to the camp | really quiet

name: Eco Camp Supot
description:
Beautiful small camping site. It is run by a family. They also have some chickens, dogs and sheep there. You can have a camping spot for tents in the Forrest or close to a fireplace. Also at the family house you can get some good food, cold beer and wine. Fresh water, Wifi, showers and a kitchen are also included. But it is only suitable for tents. Caravans couldn’t be too big. 1 Person, 1 tent with one motorcyle was about 15€.
Also difficult to find it. But you can call the Campsite owners, they speak good english and can describe the way (+386 31 683 466)

name: Lucija’s farm
description:
Very friendly owner Lucija. Camping on a farm with lots of animals, cats, dogs, horses. Only for 10 people space since there’s only 1 toilet with shower. The owner strongly requests to make reservation beforehand: 0038631335102
Per night: E12,50 per person, kids under 6 for free. Now (06/2022) €17.50 pp
Lucija Lešnjak, Grušova 11, 2229 Malečnik, Slovenija

name: Gostilna Lipan
description:
A beautifull and Charming Hotel with a nice fish restaurant. Fish comes from the river! Owners are bikers and have place in their safety garage for your bikes. They speak very good english. Bedrooms are clean and big. Breakfast is delicious and they serve only local product. Ljubljana is about 35 min with motorbike.
I paid 45€/night with breakfast.

name: Log pod Mangartom
description: Road side water tap. Road is busy so care needed. There is another roadside tap at 46.415640, 13.609882.

name: Place next to small ski centrum
description: This place is parking for ski centrum. We don’t pay. Very beautiful place,but isnt private. Water and toilet are there.

name: Free 4 places camp
description:
Official free parking lots, for 4 big rigs.
Electricity and water available in extra
Picnic area and small playground
Perfect to visit the castel
Many restaurants in the main street
Nice town

name: Grad Haasberg
description: A nice place to stop to sleep and have a rest. Wonderful sky in the night, quiet, no noises. I slept here in my Nissan Patrol.

name: Don‘t go here without the Vignette.
description:
We got on to the motorway at the last entrance before the border to Croatia. We were allowed to drive to the first exit into Slovenia, too. So we thought we wouldn’t need a Vignette. We had to pay 150€ fee and 15€ for the Vignette directly at the border.

PS: Before we got on the motorway we drove southbound parallel to it. We saw a police car and were not sure if we can cross the border on the small street so we asked them (they stopped anyways). These idiots told us we can buy the Vignette at the border for 15€ but didn’t tell us about the 150€ fee.

name: Grad Vuberk
description:
on the grassy parking Quiet restaurant closed AT 10pm free

au fond du parc de stationnement calme a 10 h le resto ferme

name: pneus
description:
ideal for changing tires fast services cheap also sells schnapS
we Cyril. 6 € per liter


idéal pour changer les pneus services rapides pas cher vend aussi du schnapS
nous Cyril. 6 € le litre

name: Spondja  Vizinga
description:
area near River road 100 m few trafic 7 pm to 9 am


un emplacement au bord de la rivière la route a 100 m peu passante la nuit

name: Hostel Hildegard
description:
Nice hostel with friendly owners. We booked a double bed room via booking.com for 52€, including breakfast.
Came from the TET from direction Zaga and it's not far off the trail. Could park the motorcycles in the driveway.
Free Wi-Fi and a neat little garden with hammocks and sun chairs.
Bathroom to be shared with others.

name: route 696
description: A grand'mother offered her flat area to stay one night near road without traffic. View of valley.

name: Vrhpolje
description:
take the path after the cemetery to the right to the end along the creek 
place to walk the premises
--
prendre le chemin apres le cimetière a droite jusqu'au bout le long du ruisseau 
lieu de promenade des locaux

name: Sokla
description:
parking entrance town quiet no train at night, not a lot of traffic
parking a l'entrée de la ville calme pas de train la nuit peu de trafic

name: Turistična kmetija Abram Nanos (Tourist Farm)
description: Nice place in the mountains. There is a restaurant and they have rooms as well. We asked to camp and they let us put our tents for free, we had dinner and breakfast though in their restaurant, prices are quite ok!

name: Viewpoint Kopitnik
description: A very nice viewpoint. You can walk up there from Uzice. Or drive up there from the other side. It's a starting point for paragliding. Looks like an amazing point for wildcamping, but not sure if it's allowed.

name: Planica Ski Center
description:
Official overnight parking spot for campers, vans etc. 12€ for campers (electrical ports available), 2,5€ for small vans and 4x4 etc. Huge area to choose if you are not attaching to electricity. 
Olympic Ski flying slopes, hikes, zipline and what not there. Interesting area and beautiful valley Tamar. 
I asked at the reception at the Ski Center and showers can be used for free. There is a bathroom and bistro. All only available at opening times. Planica Nordic Center.

name: Camping Trenta Sergej Bolčina
description:
In the middle of the mountains. Quite high, the view is splendid.
Places for tents, cars, camping cars.
Trails not far.

name: LRS - Land Rover Repairs
description: Great workshop for Defender and Discovery in Ljubljana, and passionate about Defender refurbishing. Pero is super knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. Good supply of spares. Speaks English +38640430021 (WhatsApp).

name: Water & wc
description: Potable water source and wc on one spot on the border of triglav NP

name: Vulkanizerstvo Žemlja Žemlja Janez Ml. s.p.
description: Excellent tire shop. Recommended by local campsite owner. Friendly staff. After repairing a broken valve on the rear wheel they also checked the other tyres .

name: Beside Dirt Road
description: Drive up the dirt road, over a little bridge, keep left and aprox 100meters you have a spot for the night. Little close to road, ok for one night.

name: Vodiška Planina
description: The road is very good up to the mountain, no need of 4wd. We camped behind the restaurant after we asked permission to overnight. We heard from a local friend that the food should be good there - so will go there and check it out.

name: CamperStop Šmarje pri Jelšah
description: A free place for 5 Motorhomes. You can get electricity and water. And you can dispose grey and black water.

name: krnica
description: Parking place beside mountain road, with a great view of the mountains and the valley.

name: šoder jama
description: Lake with beautiful water, on weekends is very busy, peaceful at night. Water is very clean, suitable for swimming.

name: David‘s place
description:
This is beautiful campsite established by David. Please call him before you arrive: ‭+386 70 516 222‬ 
It’s a free campsite, however, if you want  the place to be maintained as it is you are welcome to donate as much as you want and you are able to.
 
The campsite provides you with everything you need: a cold shower, a regular toilet, running water, a kitchen, a fire pit...not to mention the beautiful view of the mountains. 
If you want David can give you information about local rafting or kayaking tours.
There is two waterfalls in walking distance (20min) from the campsite where you can cliff jump and swim. 
If you stay with David please be respectful and help to make this stay a beautiful place. 

HOW TO GET THERE:
From Bovec you follow the road to Kobarid for more or less 3km. At the sign of the golf course turn right and follow the road across the golf course (don’t hesitate, it’s just old people playing golf, they don’t bite). At the end of the golf course you will cross a small bridge. Right after the bridge, turn sharp left. There will be a sign “Privat. No parking.” That belongs to David. Keep going 10m more and you will see his property on the right hand side.

name: Hidden place just off the road
description: Wild camping spot on what seems to be a walking path, but unused. Right next to the road but hidden by the trees. There is a restaurant walking distance just up the road.

name: Riverside
description: Nice clearance just off the bridge. Access to the river. During the day lots of people trying to cool down in the river. Campfires possible.

name: Magical Dragonja
description:
A field in the region of Dragonja with lots of space to set up tents. You have to cross a river with your car but it's very low. Managed it with a Seat Ibiza. 

The surrounding area is wonderful to explore! Lots of swimming spots. 

There is a summer home next to the field, but they were friendly and did not mind us camping here for a few days.

name: By the River Grad Haasberg
description:
Nice little spot by the river to camp for a night. Looks like locals come here sometimes to make a fire by the water.

Came in a group of 5 with 2 tents. 

Please don't forget to pick up your litter :)

name: Paternoster Farm Camping
description:
Really nice place. Friendly owner. Gave us tomatoes, peppers and onions for free. Place is made with a lot of passion. 18€ per camper and night. Lots of ducks, dogs and other animals around.
Bar 600m away. 3 tiny cabins available. Parking on grass, some trees for a hammock if you have long straps. Very nice and clean place opposite of the fire fighter station.

name: mountain view
description: Nice spot for the night. In the morning gorgeous view on Triglav peak and the valley.

name: Camp Plana Pivka
description:
Nice place for travelers and good food lovers. Not overpriced. 
10€ per person, 5€ tent spot, pets allowed 1€. 
Showers and toilets are new and classy. 
Quite a few cool places around: Military museum, Postojna cave, some hiking spots. 
Very good food in bar.

name: Motorhome parking
description: There are 3 parking spots in Lasko. Wifi, water, waste water, electricity are free according to sign. Didn't see a sign that says: No overnight parking. So I guess it it allowed. located next to a Spar supermarket and train station with toilets.   Probably trains will pass by and make noise.

name: wild juta house
description: wild juta house. you can upgrade it if you want.

name: Flosar Reataurant
description: Family reataurant with space for 3-4 tents. Free wifi, restrooms, nice restaurant. A real FIND!

name: Picnic Areas
description:
Moderator Note: The description indicates that the Place is for picnics. Please verify that it is acceptable to stay overnight,
.....
One of two designated "picnic areas" on this bike path. Has picnic table, very clean porta-potty, restaurant less than 300 meters away.

name: Riverside
description: We found this nice little spot next to the river. It’s somewhat close to the road so there is a little road noise, but it is closer to the river so mostly you just hear rushing water. There are no toilets or electricity and if you don’t have 4 Wheel or at least all wheel drive it *may* be tricky to get down to the spot, or rather back up to the road. But it’s also very nice to go for a little swim in the river (though it was very cold).

name: jezero mola
description:
Clean small site close to a warm water lake.
Not sure how legal it is. I was here during summer week and had no people here what so ever. I think fisher might use this place intens. Take care of the environment please.

name: pomjan hidden viewpoint over koper
description: This is on a field and hunters do hunt here. Keep it clean and make no fire or you will get visitors from the locals. This region is firehazardus.

name: Roadside parking (free)
description:
Free parking by the side of the road. Enough space for 4 motorhomes. 
Picnic area with tables and bin.

Cars pass by, but it doesn’t bother. Not much of a view.

One of the few places around with free parking.

name: Swimming area
description: A very nice and clean place to have a swim. There is a picnic area with toilets, shower and tables/benches. Great for during the day but camping overnight here is not allowed.

name: Strmec
description: Roadside public fountain, drinking water.

name: Free flat area next to viewing tower
description: Nice and clean spot, space for multiple rigs, right next to a wooden tower. No facilities.

name: Small side road near quarry remains
description: Small offshoot from the main road below the remains of an old quarry. Invisible to passers-by at night, visible during daylight. We reversed about a 100m into the path to not be right by the road.

name: Scenic road - Incredibly beautiful
description: Very-very beautiful scenery along the road. A lot of it is unpaved but 4wd is not required. Multiple water sources next to the road.

name: Organic Winery
description: Lovely Winery which doesn't advertise that they offer space for campers or tents. The owners speak English and offer tastings of their orange wine. There is a toilet, no shower, and plenty of space for tents and cars. They charged €10 per night for the two of us.

name: Restaurant Koblarjev Bay
description: Restaurant parking lot next to river Drau, toilets from the restaurant, electricity, and water. All for free donation. Good food at the restaurant.

name: Smrekovec
description: Forest wild campsite with superb view. Large enough for few cars.

name: Camping Prosca
description:
At the time we are here (september 2021) no toilets or other type of facilities. No running water or electricity, though our one camping companion has found a drinking water source nearby and provided a large container of water. 

Nice quiet field in the wood. Looks like the owner is building up the place; planted some fruit trees, halfway built a wooden house. 

From the road a small way in the bush over a small creek (don’t need 4x4)

name: if the lake nearby is too crowded
description: flat, big, quiet. we came here because the lake was too crowded. the corn was high in september and nobody could see us at night using outdoor light. minus: there is a hughe electrical power line over the place. for us it was ok. nice sunrise in the morning

name: Kamp Tura
description: Nice practical camp, with spacious pitches for campers. Also extra place for tents. Dogs are welcome. Great for climbers. Nearby is tennis court and climbing wall. Very kind staff and nice bar.

name: Waterside Wildcamping Spot
description: Small, very pretty spot for camping/vibing next to a small lake. Cars bigger than a VW Bus might be tricky. Pls pick up your litter.

name: Beautiful place next to river
description: Large grassy parking lot where you can spend the night. It belongs to a river boat company and the owner allows campers to stay. We only spoke to him in the morning and he said we could stay as long as we want.

name: Beside a pub by the river
description: This is an actual free motorhome overnight area, but you'd never know it. Mid October we were the only ones here on a Saturday night, but I'm sure it's busier during the summer months. Washroom available at the pub.

name: Free overnight
description:
A large gravel lot dedicated to motorhome campers. Trash facility, and free WiFi. Water tap and outhouse nearby.
 Room for 30 motorhomes, been here mid October night and we were the only ones here. 
No place to empty toilet cassettes. Even has two free electric outlets.

name: Bicycle shop Bajkmanija
description:
Great bike shop where you can find rare and special parts - big and small ones. Super nice and helpful staff.
They will do their best to help you out!

name: Kaki Plac
description: Kaki Place is a little campground in the woods. Space for max 40 people. No Campervans or cars, but motorcycle is possible.

name: Logar Valley Lay-by by Church
description: Little lay-by just off road next to beautiful church and surrounded by mountains with incredible view. Good for 1 possibly 2 nights. We stayed in January and had no issues. There is a plaque with a motor home printed on it which suggests that it is allowed to stay here.

name: bled, slovenie
description: beautiful quit, sunny spot nearby lake bled

name: top of the hill
description:
Only for campers. A wonderful place accessible by foot.
There is flat place on the top of the hill. It's quiet , out of sight and fantastic view

name: Furman Guesthouse
description: Guesthouse with Pizzeria below. We paid €50/night for a one bedroom apartment for two people. (Washing machine in room.) What we liked most about this place is that they are outfitted for motorcycles. A parking garage specifically for them, with a place to hang your gear and rags to wipe it. Pizzeria had great pizza and prices ranged from €6-10 each. The location is ideal if you are riding the TET.

name: Apartment Natasa
description: We paid about €45 in off season for two people for a room with two beds, private bath and a kitchen. Kitchen is outside the room. I say approx because we booked on Booking.com, but you can just show up. There is a €2/pp tourist tax as well. Owner gave us a welcome drink and snack, plus a little souvenir. Beautiful town and views, with lots of hiking trails nearby. Covered spot to park your Motos. 👍🏻

name: Pr. Smolet
description: New and modern apartments in a little village on a hilltop. Great views and extremely kind owners. Susan and her husband have a shop where they make and sell local liquor, lots of options and good prices. We were welcomed with a thorough tasting of as many liquors as we liked. €60 for a nice studio apartment with amazing view. Susan can provide breakfast on request for €8 per person. Lots of parking space.

name: Smartinski Park
description: Parking lot by the park. It’s paid parking. €0.60 per hour and €12 per day M-F. It appears to be free on weekends. It’s open 24hrs. I had breakfast here on a Sunday with slider facing the park. Quiet with some park patrons out on a job, riding bike, and walking their dogs.

name: Podgorje border with Herzogovena
description: Approached this border and wont permit us to cross with UK passports post Brexit.  Advised to go to Kozina

name: University Campus
description:
Cheap parking area near the centre of Ljubljana. 10 min to walk to the center.
8h parking 3,5€ and from 19.00-7.00 1,50€. We stayed here one night with our 6.5m truck.

name: Wild camp near lake
description: Big grass space near a lake. Leveled and flat. A bit bumpy to arrive but ok. Good for tent, car or caravan.

name: Camping & Camper Stop near Ljubljana
description: Camping in Dol pri Ljubljani is a small campsite located in nature just 15 min from the town, available for motorhomes, camping tents, cars or travel trailers. It's well equipped with everything you need: showers, toilets, washing machine, electricity & water supply, dump station (for grey and black wastewater), free WIFI internet access, large covered terrace with sits and tables, etc. Camper stop offers parking spaces on the lawn or paved surface (also possible under the roof). Good connections to Ljubljana town (BUS/train), bike rental, hiking options on nearby hills, rock climbing, guided yoga & meditation sessions, wine tasting, vegetables, musical evenings, and more. Also offers camper repair, wash, and indoor winter storage for campers

name: Herzerlstrasse
description:
You could pay €5 pp to take a picture, also you can consume some food and drinks. 
I think €5 is a total rip off!!!

name: CARWASH Zaldska
description:
24/7 carwash, self service. 1.5€ per jeton.
needed 2 to clean my motorbike after some offroad (TET)

name: picnic area on route to Vršič Pass
description: Picnic area next to a historic telpher line display. There's a picnic table with benches and access (via long steep steps) to the river. We put our tent & moto next to the wall to stay out of sight. Camping cars would be visible to the road but little traffic after dark. No signs prohibiting camping. Nice spot for a night.

name: Soka Pot (free access to beautiful gorge)
description: Access to a beautiful gorge and to the river. Paid parking lot. Toilet in parking area. Crowded but nice area.

name: unused forest road
description: We passed a quiet night camped in our tent on this unused (we think) forest road. We wanted to camp at the nearby "mountain view" spot but the road there was too rocky for our moto. We found this instead; good spot in the forest for motorcycles & bicycles,likely ok for camping cars too but may have to back out since the road is narrow. Near road but not visible.

name: Camping @ Nogometni Golf
description: Small, simple, nice campground. large grassy area for tents and camping cars. Some shade. Just 4 toilets & 2 showers but clean. Nice covered area with tables, benches, refrigerators & sink for washing dishes. No electricity for camping cars but charging point for mobil phones, etc.. Nice owners. 10.50 € + 3.13€ city tax pp.

name: nice spot next to road
description: We passed a quiet night in our tent in this little grassy area just off the main road. It's possible to camp/park where you're out of sight (or mostly out of sight) of passing cars. Good spot for tent campers or camping cars.

name: Kamp Lazar Edi Lazar sp
description: A beautiful campsite you drive in and is looking for your place and reception is in the restaurant and food is also good looking good for me as a motorcycle ride also voor 4x4 and the big campers

name: river stop/rest area
description: nice stop if you want to go for a cold swim! huge parking area, free wifi, picnic area. don't think you can spend the night

name: Speleo Camp
description: Nice, small, quiet, family run camping place mostly used by cavers and climbers. Owner speaks english and has a very nice dog.

name: Football and picnic place
description: Football and picnic place. Kids area. Water, clean, free. We stopped for picnic but I think it's OK to sleep here.

name: Logarska Dolina
description: A dry riverside place. Can accommodate several tents, parking 200 meters away.

name: Near Ankaraska Plaza
description: 54€ for one person is way too much especially if you get a place which is only mud and it was really hard to get the tent pegs in because the ground is really hard. don't go here!

name: Camp Jelinčič
description: Camp located right next to the Soča river. Clean, shared toilets and showers, with warm water. Lot of place for tents and campers.  Arranged fireplaces. Electricity on some spots. Local specialities (cheese and fishes) in their own restaurant. Very nice family owners. Dog friendly

name: Mountain Lookout
description:
Just on the Slovenia side of the border is a small disused forest track that switchbacks up the mountain to a flat lookout spot. 
Great views and the track shows little to no signs of use. It's rutted out and the last part is steep so 4x4 recommended. You can always stop further down the hill and camp as well.

name: plaža
description: local place, open for overland wisitors.

name: Voda
description: It's a little fountain in a parking in city.

name: Za Blatom
description: Parallel to the 911 runs the old road, which is a good gravel road. This spot is a larger flat clearing in the forest, but several spots can be found along the track.

name: Krnica
description: On a dead end of a forest road is a larger clearing.

name: falkenau
description: Very good restaurant. It was the fourth Time since 10 years (we love Slovénia) and it's allways a good expérience. Squid stuffed with ham and cheese, Bear goulasch, Nice staff and service continued ( we arrived at 3 pm and people are still arriving at 4.30...

name: Toyota garage
description: Very knowledgeable Toyota garage and almost everybody speaks English.

name: Ljubliana Resort Hotel&Camp
description: Big campsite for all kind of recreational vehicles. Bus stop is on the other side of the road and takes you straight to the city center. Price (without electricity) in high season is 45 euro's. During the night, you have some noise from passing trains (but not too bad). Next door there is also a pool, but you have to additionally pay for it.

name: Vargalant
description: If a 'normal' garage can't help you (because they don't have parts for example), this workplace can make replacement (fake) parts and install them. They also have a big selection of oils and additives.

name: Borovnici
description: A few spots in the forest, on a sidetrack of an unpaved (gravel) forest road. Not suitable for big vehicles. Nobody around during the day or night (we stayed a couple of nights). Some chamois and dear visited us (on a distance).

name: Kamp Beli Gaber
description: Small campground. opened June 2022. Simple tent pitches on terraces. Excellent facilities.

name: Cvetlin
description: Border crossing only for EU citizens. All passports are checked on the Slovenian side of the border (both directions), but delay is minimal.

name: Celje Community RV spot
description: There are six level parking slots for RVs at the end of the parking lot.  2.50 euros to park weekdays from 6am to 3pm.  free after that and IV weekends. Cassette dumping free, water is 50 cents for 40L, power is 50 cents a kWh.  Pit toilets in the park area and bathrooms in the ice arena when it's open.  Free wifi from the arena too.  4G cell reception. 800m walk across a pedestrian bridge into old town.

name: Slovenia, near the border with Austria
description: One of the best spots we've ever found. Magnificent views. Next to vines. Near the viewing platform, so steep climb for the last section. Not for big rigs. Space for two vans parked considerately. Bin.

name: Maribor free car park.
description: Large rough gravel free car park, no restrictions. An easy cycle into this pretty town.

name: Puklavec Tourist Farm
description: Wine region. Grassy spot overlooking the vineyard. Pricey at 20 euros, but clean WC and free electricity and water and the view is superb. Restaurant attached serving inexpensive plat du jour and local wine.

name: Grad Otocec Castle, Riverside
description: A riverside gravel free car park on the cycle trail near the castle (which is a hotel). No overnight parking opposite the hotel. We parked further away, descreetly for one night we no pleoblem. Small vans only.

name: Kocevski Rog Old Saw Mill
description: Rough car park in open ground, once a saw mill, near to Scout accommodation, currently unoccupied. Trail to highest point in the forest, Veliki Rog. Quiet. Access on route 917 is largely unmade and an be narrow.

name: Pension Gostilna Jezero - Tušek
description: Great Slovenian food. Good price. Next to car parking by lake.

name: smart wash laundromat
description: New machines. Clean room. Large car park. 20kg 8 euro, 10kg 5 euro at time of writing. You have to change cash to tokens. No card payment.

name: Parking on the pass with great view
description: Parking short term for splendid views of mountains.

name: Lepa Vida Vipava Valley Osek Vineyard Camperstop
description: Very quiet. Gravel car park next to the Vineyard where you can purchase or taste the wine. Delightful owners. 10 euro. Water, dump, toilets, WiFi free. Electric extra. No showers.

name: Forest Clearing
description: Clearing in the forest, flat area under a bunch of trees in the middle and in area around. Off-road track leading into it off the main forest gravel road. Camped for one night with motorbike and small tent.

name: Wild Camping for bicycles or Motorbikes
description: Nice Area close to the road heading to Croatia, but out of sight. It is good reachable for motorbikes or bicycles. we spend on night there with a tent and two motorcycles. Maybe some people with their dog will come by, but they didn't say anything to us.

name: wild camping (no vehicle access)
description:
Quiet place, very close to the Castle and the caves, only for motorcycles or bicycles.

Español
Lugar tranquilo, muy cerca del Castillo y de las cuevas, solo para motos o bici.

name: Top Rafting Center
description:
We came here because of a recommendation. When we arrived no one was here so we called the top rafting company and asked if we could stay for a night. The owner told us that we came off season but he was so friendly that we could stay anyway and are welcome to use the warm shower and toilett. 
Normaly it is just for customer of the rafting company but they have very nice bungalows and brand new facilities! 
We left some cash for the owner even he said we can stay for free. Highly recommended place next to the river between the mountains!!

name: GreenSLO Hostel
description: A hostel about 2.7kms from Preseren Square. Comfy 5 beds dorm at EUR15 + EUR3 (government tax) per night (Booking.com). There is a kitchen & washing machine. Wifi is fast. Indoor parking for motorbikes & may be 4 cars. Can also park for free on the street.

name: Camper van parking near Pizza
description:
Small car park with barrier to get in and out. Right down by the beach. The facilities are okay could be cleaner though. The spot is directly on the sea and you can walk to piran in 10 minutes along a beautiful way along the sea.

Normally you pay 35€ for one night but for two we got a discount and paid 30pN for 3 person and one camper!

name: Trstelj
description:
Flat gravel parking place and starting point for hiking and MTB.
Nobody came and it was a quiet night. The gravel road is good to drive and with 4x4 you could go further up to the summit with 360 ° view to the sea and the dolomites (or 15 min. by foot aprox.). Trash bin.

name: Technical Museum of Slovenia
description: Nice, quiet spot near Technical Museum of Slovenia. Also Restaurant beside the campside, open Tuesday to Sunday.

name: Skofja Loka
description:
New and beautiful b&b, just breakfast. 
Good Restaurant in 50 Meter! Helpful owner speak english and german. Have a garage for my motorbike. Breakfast with fresh egg variations is wonderful! Parking place for cars. Family friendly but quite 
Very near to the historic old town from Škofja Loka!
We payed the cheapest price about € 65,-

name: Kamp Fiesa
description: Fine place to camp but overpriced. 35 euros for small tent, two small motorbikes and two people. Tent pitches are sub optimal and placed near a main road. However, wonderful location near a beautiful beach and a 20 minute scenic walk into old Piran.

name: Wild camp along a gravel Road
description: Small place quiet flat, a lot of « ail des Ours » plant, calm, though few car passes during night

name: bivak pod srnjakom
description: small lookout with great view. has a shelter.

name: Turizem Benetič
description:
A small campground next to the river. 20 euro for the night, 2pp and a van.
The owner is a lovely lady who gave us wood for our barbecue. Laundry and dryer included in the price.
Clean bathroom and hot shower.
Don't miss this place, it worth it!

name: Free - Drava riverside
description:
An established motor home site for 6 vehicles of any size, right on the bank of the River Drava. Free parking, free drinking water, free grey water dump, free black water dump and even free electricity - all paid for by the local authorities to aid tourism. 

The grass verges are neatly cut and bins are provided for rubbish. Please keep the place clean and respect what has been given to us.

name: Vrtovče pod ovinkom
description: Very tasteful and cold water all around the year. It is by the road, so you can't miss it.

name: Kraški vodovod
description: Water tap at the crossroads Komen - Sela na Krasu. Very good water, you cannot miss the location.

name: Old Wood loggers place
description:
Little cut in the woods, perfect for one night. Only with 4x4. Seems to be an old wood log working area. Completely quiet, not to be seen from the main road. 
Take your trash with you!

name: Water fountain Šempas
description: Water tap by the road in the small park with stone pavement.

name: Izvir Hublja
description: Water tap by the beautiful river source of river Hubelj.

name: Stador Ac trgovina in storitve d.o.o.
description: Workshop where they fix campers and trailers. Owner is very experienced, having worked 26 years at Adria plant. They're busy but helpful, although I strongly suggest to book an appointment well in advance.

name: Farm Brzan - winery
description: This place sells their own wine. If you buy 3 bottles ~27 euro , you can stay for free. Place offers 2 showers, toilet and great view over the valley - vinska klet vilij +386 31 480 905 call in advance!

name: Zavrstnik
description: great place to add water in your bidons. fresh at every moment. open 24/7

name: Servis Motoris Koles
description: Andrej is a specialist for motorcycles, especially for Royal Enfield and Ducati, including Oldtimers.

name: Mirenski grad
description: Water fountain by the castle above the settlement Miren. Water flows non-stop and is cool enough even in the summer.

name: water fountain
description: drinking water fountain by the side of the road next to bench and bike racks

name: Besnica
description: great water, open 24/7, crossing for hike, bike Besnica Pečar, nearby Ljubljana

name: Water tap by the river Soča
description: Water tap on the bank of the gorgeous river Soča. Good and cold water even in the summer.

name: Under the highway
description: There is a big parking place inder the highway and there is also a water tap.

name: Cycling path G-1
description: Water tap at the cycling path G-1 (Solkan-Plave). Very tasty water and cold even in the summer.

name: Trg Marko Anton Plenčič
description: Water tap in the town square. Use button on the ground to open the water flow.

name: Igrišče Zaloŝče
description: Water tap by the road, next to the basketball playground.

name: Gorenja vas
description: Water tap in the middle of the village. May be closed during the winter, otherwise it is quite reliable.

name: Kanal na ovinku
description: Water tap in the town Kanal on the road bend.

name: Ložice pipa
description: Water tap by the road with two sitting benches.

name: Šempeter Skate Park
description: There is a playground and skate park with toilets and water.

name: Municipal campsite Zuzemberk
description:
public campsite of the city of Zuzemberk. next to the river, beautiful views of the castle. No fresh water provided, toilets at the bar nearby, great place for swimming in the river. 
Free Drinking water at the square infront of the castle (free WiFi there as well)

name: By the river near bled
description: Small beach next to the river. A few places for tents or campers. No 4x4 needed

name: Upholstery Sandi - Tapetništvo Sandi
description:
They will make and install everything for your motor home or boat - from swivel seats, insulated windscreen covers to refurbishing old seats and campervan beds.

BEST PART: while they are working you can easily spend the night or two in the backyard and refill water + electricity + wifi

name: 1 Gradsko, 1385 Nova vas, Slovenia
description: This is truly one of our best sites ever - they only take one van or two if travelling as a group (Transit/ camper van size). Spectacular, uninterrupted views of miles of forest and hills, peaceful and tranquil with lots of walks nearby. Miso and his family are wonderful generous hosts who offer salad and veg from his garden. There is outdoor shower and sawdust toilet with the best ‘loo view’ we’ve ever had. We planned one night but stayed 5 - it’s difficult to leave.

name: Tina Raft
description:
Small, nice Campground next to the river, beautiful view, electricity available for an additional 4€/day. It’s a quiet place.
Staff is nice, showers are hot and clean (but only 2 showers available). There is also a small bar. 
We paid 24€ for one night in a camper van. There is also an area dedicated for tents. They didn’t charge us for our dog.

name: Hostel Trobenta in Oblak
description:
Very simple hostel with a big garden. They also allow people to put up a tent or to park a van in front of their house. They have a kitchen and washing machine you can use. Shower has hot water, it’s not new or nice, but okay. Dogs are allowed. Electricity is available inside of the building.
We parked our van in the garden and were able to see the sea from our roof top tent. 
But: They charged us 40€ for one night (we didn’t get a room, just parking and sleeping in our van). It’s very loud at night due to heavy traffic next to the house. The main road is just in front of the building.

name: Laundromat
description: Small Laundromat, self service. The washing machines are big and well maintained

name: Rest Stop on Freeway - power, water, wifi and dump
description: Motor home parking space with power connection, Chemical toilet disposal and water connection.  Suitable for big rigs.  Two spaces. All free.

name: Winez Camping
description:
Informal campground. They will allow you to park on the dirt road beneath the house for the night. Toilets are in the house up the hill (which isn’t great if you have to use the toilet at night, there are no lights and you‘ll have to go up the hill). Showers are modern, clean and hot. There is also a natural pond where you can swim in, but we didn’t try it. 
It’s very quiet at night. Make sure you use the paved road to get there. Google Maps might try to guide you through the wine fields with no established road and with a usual car that route is impossible to follow. By bike you should be fine though. 
23€/night for 2 people.

name: snakebite paradise
description:
secluded open spot in the forest. 
only accesible by 4x4 and no big rigs. 
it's on a mountainfarm and the owners have a mtb trailcenter and is a licenced mtb guide. 

no pets and a maximum of 2 vehicles.

name: Power, Water, WC and dump… on highway
description: Motor home parking space with power connection, Chemical toilet disposal and water connection. Suitable for big rigs. Two spaces. All free.
